casebody.data:
NORTH CAROLINA STATE CONFERENCE OF the NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR the ADVANCEMENT OF COLORED PEOPLE
v.
Tim MOORE, in his official capacity, Philip Berger, in his official capacity, The North Carolina Bipartisan State Board of Elections And Ethics Enforcement, Andrew Penry, in his official capacity, Joshua Malcolm, in his official capacity, Ken Raymond, in his official capacity, Stella Anderson, in her official capacity, Damon Circosta, in his official capacity, Stacy Eggers IV, in his official capacity, Jay Hemphill, in his official capacity, Valerie Johnson, in her official capacity, John Lewis, in his official capacity No. 261P18 Supreme Court of North Carolina. September 4, 2018 Kimberley Hunter, Attorney at Law, David L. Neal, Attorney at Law, Mary MacLean Asbill, Attorney at Law, Brooks Rainey Pearson, Attorney at Law, Irving Joyner, Attorney at Law, Durham, Daryl V. Atkinson, Attorney at Law, Leah J. Kang, Attorney at Law, for NC NAACP. Martin Warf, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Amar Majmundar, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Special Deputy Attorney General, Noah H. Huffstetler, III, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Moore, Tim, et al. Robert F. Orr, Attorney at Law, Asheville, for North Carolina Professors of Constitutional Law.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Plaintiff on the 1st of September 2018 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 4th of September 2018."
